Relative risk (RR) is the ratio of the risk of developing the disease in the exposed group to the risk of developing the disease in the unexposed group. The formula for RR is (a / [a + b]) / (c / [c + d]), where a is the number of exposed patients who contracted the disease, b is the number of exposed patients who did not contract the disease, c is the number of unexposed patients who contracted the disease, and d is the number of unexposed patients who did not contract the disease.

RR = (30 / (30 + 70)) / (1 / (1 + 99))
   = 0.3 / 0.01
   = 30
